Here's the real video of the Christmas message ...

 What's funny is the silly reaction everyone's giving it, like it's some gawd-awful breach of separation of church and state or something. emoticon_rolleyes Good grief.
 
 The pres. of the Catholic League--yes, The Catholic League(!)-- went on record saying 'Huckabee went beyond wishing people a joyous holiday. Donahue said he was especially disturbed by the cross-like image created by a white bookcase in the background of the ad, saying he believed it was a subliminal message.' (!!!) I would think the Catholic league would find this commercial appealing, since it's consistent (or certainly non-contradictory) toward their beliefs, but whatever.
 
 Either way, Huckabee's response was great: "I will confess this: If you play the spot backwards it says, 'Paul is dead. Paul is dead.'"
 
 "He was joking about the Beatles' recording of "The White Album" and the urban legend that if a portion of the album is played backwards, the words "Paul is dead" is heard, a reference to the very much alive Paul McCartney."
